Text: Nun. By the pen and what they write.
By the grace of your Rabb you are not a madman,
and you shall have a never ending reward.
You are of the highest noble character.
Soon you will see - as they will see
- which of you is afflicted with madness.
Surely it is your Rabb Who knows those who have strayed from His\n\t\t\tWay, as He knows best those who are rightly guided.
So do not yield to the unbelievers.
They desire you to compromise a little, so they too would\n\t\t\tcompromise.
Neither yield to any mean oath-monger,
mischief making slanderer,
opponent of good, transgressor,
wicked oppressor, and above all, ignoble by birth,
though he be possessing wealth and children.
When Our revelations are recited to him , he says: "They are\n\t\t\tnothing but the tales of the ancient."
Soon We shall brand him on the snout.
Surely We shall try them as We tried the owners of the garden\n\t\t\twhen they swore that they would pluck its fruit the next morning,
without adding any reservation ( such as God willing).
So a calamity from your Rabb came down upon it while they slept,
and by the morning it lay as if it had been already harvested.
At daybreak they called out to one another,
saying: "Go out early to your crop, if you want to pick its\n\t\t\tfruit."
So they went, whispering to one another:
"Let no needy person enter upon you in the garden today."
Thus they went out, fixed in their stingy resolve (not to give\n\t\t\tany fruit to the poor people, as if they had the full control\n\t\t\tover harvesting the fruit).
But when they saw the garden, they cried: "Surely we must have\n\t\t\tlost our way!
Nay, we have become destitute."
The most upright among them said: "Did I not tell you to glorify\n\t\t\tAllah? Why did you not glorify Him?"
Then they said: "Glory be to our Rabb! Surely we were unjust,"
and they started blaming one another.
Finally they said: "Woe to us! Surely we had become rebellious.
It may be that our Rabb will give us in exchange a better garden\n\t\t\tthan this: surely to our Rabb do we make our humble petition."
Such is the punishment in this life; but the punishment in the\n\t\t\tHereafter is even greater, if they but knew it.
Surely the righteous will be rewarded with gardens of delight by\n\t\t\ttheir Rabb.
What do the disbelievers think? Shall We treat the Muslims as We\n\t\t\ttreat the guilty?
What is the matter with you? What kind of judgement do you make?
Or do you have a Book in which you read,
that you shall be given whatever you choose?
Or do you have a sworn covenant - a covenant binding on Us till\n\t\t\tthe Day of Resurrection - that you shall have whatever you\n\t\t\tdemand?
Ask if any of them will vouch for that.
Or do they have other gods who could help them against Allah? If\n\t\t\tso, let them produce their other gods if they are truthful.
On the Day of Judgement, when the dreadful events shall be\n\t\t\tunfolded, and they shall be asked to prostrate themselves, they\n\t\t\tshall not be able to do so.
They shall stand with eyes downcast, utterly humbled; because\n\t\t\tduring their safe and sound earthly life they were called upon to\n\t\t\tprostrate themselves but they refused to do so.
O Prophet, leave to Me those who reject this revelation. We shall\n\t\t\tlead them step by step to their ruin, in ways that they cannot\n\t\t\tperceive.
I shall even put up with them for a while; for My plan is fool\n\t\t\tproof.
Or have you, O Prophet, demanded a compensation from them, that\n\t\t\tthey are overburdened with debt?
Or do they have the knowledge of the unseen and they are writing\n\t\t\tit down?

So wait with patience for the Judgement of your Rabb and be not\n\t\t\tlike the man of the fish (reference is to the Prophet Jonah who\n\t\t\twas swallowed by a whale), who cried when he was in distress.
Had his Rabb not bestowed on him His grace, he would certainly\n\t\t\thave been cast off on the naked shore, while he was condemned.
But his Rabb choose him and included him among the righteous.
The unbelievers would almost trip you up with their eyes when\n\t\t\tthey hear Our revelations (The Qur'an), and say: "He (Muhammad)\n\t\t\tis surely crazy."
This (The Qur'an) is nothing but a Reminder to all the people of\n\t\t\tthe world.
